channel.description:
Continuing the discussion from [Meta-meta discussions](https://forum.openglobalmind.com/t/meta-meta-discussions/406):
Yes, I think it is as described here:
https://meta.discourse.org/t/whats-the-best-way-to-branch-off-a-discussion-from-a-topic/48791
Use the "link" at the bottom of any post to create a "linked discussion".
But this then needs to be taught to people who use this site so that they don't hijack threads with clutter.

item.description:
peterkaminski:

split topics and get them sorted into the right place

Yes, a facilitation or curation team can help with that to some extent in young communities with a few dozens of members and 100s of post. Not so, with 100s of active members, 10,100s of posts, and 100+ categories of ‚Äúright places.‚Äù

At that stage, issues of taxonomy, tagsonomy, visual content map, navigation structures, knowledge graphs, and the like kicks in because without the community tech stewards diving into those kinds of niceties, it could become very challenging to identify what is the right place, both when we want to post or find something.

The affordance is structurally sound, but I feel like it‚Äôs not quite primary enough UI-wise. And, I don‚Äôt know how easy it would be to do in arrears. (I.e., it‚Äôs sometimes hard to tell if you‚Äôve forked the conversational topic, until you‚Äôre a few messages down one fork or the other.)

It‚Äôs also possible just to do inline links: Meta-meta discussions - Designing the System / Tools - Open Global Mind Forum, or infobox links:

Meta-meta discussions Tools
Hi @peterkaminski Discourse seems quite nice in one particular way: it is soaking up less of my attention than the mailing list was. However, I‚Äôm a bit surprised that it doesn‚Äôt seem to have much built in ability to do ‚Äúmeta-‚Ä¶‚Äù discussions. Yes, we can HAVE them, but that‚Äôs not marked inside the system. Often that a thread will get started and someone will come along and take it in a completely different direction. On Wikipedia this kind of ‚Äúdirectorial‚Äù intervention would go into a talk pa‚Ä¶

Which isn‚Äôt trivially easy to do within the Discourse interface, but neither is it particularly hard.

BTW, another tool we‚Äôll likely start to use is gentle human facilitation and moderation to split topics and get them sorted into the right place (as well as having better ‚Äúright‚Äù places):

Forming a Moderation Team Site Feedback
@RobOK and I had a good conversation today covering both Suggestion for Topic Areas to promote discussion over time and How much curating/moderation should be done here?.
